channel.title: AgroFIMS Help Page on AgroFIMS Help Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in AgroFIMS Help Page on AgroFIMS Help Documentation
channel.copyright: Copyright © AgroFIMS 2020 [Terms of Use and Privacy Policy](https://agrofims.github.io/helpdocs/policyterms/)

item.title: About
item.description: The Agronomy Field Information Management System (AgroFIMS) allows users to create fieldbooks to collect agronomic data that is already tied to a metadata standard (the CG Core Metadata Schema, aligned with the standard Dublin Core), and semantic standards like the Agronomy Ontology (AgrO), generating data that is Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable (FAIR) at collection. AgroFIMS therefore standardizes data collection and description for easy aggregation and inter-linking across disparate datasets. By December 2020 you will be able to export the fieldbooks you create to the Android-based KDSmart or Field Book applications for data collection.

item.title: Adding a crop or a variety to the experiment
item.description: 1. Select the type of cropping system of your experiment. Currently the choices are: Monocrop, Intercrop or Relay crop. 2. Select the crop’s common name. If the crop is not listed, select ‘’Other’’ and specify the crop common name. If “Intercrop” or “Relay crop” are selected, AgroFIMS will require you to add at least 2 crops. To add more, click on “add crop”. 3. Enter the variety name. You can enter as many varieties as needed.

item.title: Adding personnel
item.description: Click on the button Add Personnel to add a new person to the experiment.

item.title: Create a new experiment
item.description: In the menu select Experiments Click on the button New Experiment Enter an experiment name Click on the button Create to validate

item.title: Creating a new fieldbook
item.description: Click on the button Add Fieldbook Choose a country in the drop-down list Choose a site in the drop-down list To be able to create a new fieldbook, you must have created your site first. To create your site, click on Create new site

item.title: Creating a new site
item.description: Before creating your fielbook, you may want to create the site of your experiment. Select Sites in the Menu. Click on the button New site. Fill the information about the site type, site name, country name and administrative divisions using text boxes and picklists as appropriate. You can zoom in the map to help you find the name of your location, but you cannot use the map to directly pinpoint the site.

item.title: Exporting AgroFIMS fieldbook in a format readable by Field Book
item.description: To upload an AgroFIMS fieldbook to Field Book, you have to first export the AgroFIMS fieldbook as a .zip file and then unzip it. Go to Experiments in the left-hand panel menu and select the experiment of your choice. Go to the Fieldbooks tab at the top. Open the fieldbook of your choice by clicking on the “open” icon (square with an arrow through it).

item.title: Privacy policy
item.description: Effective date: January 01, 2020 WHAT TYPE OF PERSONAL DATA DO WE COLLECT FROM USERS AND HOW DO WE MANAGE IT? When signing up to AgroFIMS, we ask you for information such as your name, last name, email, name of organization you work with, and the country you live in. Providing this information is mandatory to create an account and use AgroFIMS. We respect user privacy; accordingly, any personally identifiable information you provide is protected by SSL encryption when it is exchanged with AgroFIMS and will only be used for internal purposes in accordance with site-specific policies, or in ways to which you have explicitly consented.

item.title: Set in production mode
item.description: The application downloaded is in Demo DB mode. To enable all the functionalities the mode Production has to be enabled. In the home screen, click on the menu icon on the top left, and select Settings. 2. In the Settings menu, click on Active Database Select Production To go back to the home screen, click on the arrow at the top left.

item.title: Signing Up
item.description: Go to AgroFIMS. Enter your email, password, name, last name, organization and country. Click Create. Your account has been created. You can Log in and start using AgroFIMS. An email will be sent to your mailbox to confirm your account. Don’t forget to check your spam folder if you don’t see the email in your inbox!

item.title: Send KDSmart file to mobile device
item.description: Once you have downloaded a .kdx file, you have to send it to the device where KDSmart is installed. For this you have three options: Via email: send an email to yourself or the data collector, with the .kdx file attached. Open this email on the mobile device where KDSmart is installed and download the .kdx file in the folder ‘’Download’’ of the mobile device. Via a cloud: On your laptop save the .

item.title: Edit fieldbook
item.description: Click on the Open icon on the right side of the Fieldbook line to open it.

item.title: Experiment ID
item.description: The Experiment ID is a code generated by AgroFIMS to uniquely name experiments. It is made up of the 2 first letters of Experiment name + the 2 first letters of Experiment project name + unique number

item.title: Export AgroFIMS fieldbook
item.description: To upload an AgroFIMS fieldbook in KDSmart, you have to first export the AgroFIMS fieldbook as a .kdx file. Select Experiments in the Menu and select the experiment of our choice. Go to the Fieldbooks tab and open the fieldbook of your choice by clicking on “open” icon (square with an arrow through it). Click on the cloud icon at the top right of the window.

item.title: Home screen
item.description: Button to open and close the Menu Menu

item.title: Loading my info
item.description: You can start by adding your profile information using the button ‘’ Load my info’’ . This will auto-fill the boxes with information registered in your profile.

item.title: Logging in
item.description: At the upper right corner of the Home page, click on and select Log In Enter your email and your password. Click Log In

item.title: Open Source
Use of AgroFIMS
item.description: Effective date: January 01, 2020 YOUR PRIVACY We respect user privacy and manage any personally identifiable information collected by us from you through AgroFIMS in accordance with our PRIVACY POLICY. COPYRIGHT Copyright © 2019 International Potato Center – CIP AgroFIMS is an online interface conceived to standardizes agronomic data collection. CIP holds the title to the online AgroFIMS and to the materials and content generated by AgroFIMS unless otherwise specified.

item.title: Viewing site information
item.description: Go to Sites in the Menu. Click on the eye icon next to the site you want to get information about.

item.title: What is Fieldbook ID?
item.description: Fieldbook ID is a unique identifier created by AgroFIMS to identify your experiment. It is made of the concatenation of the following information: F_Cropping type_Crop name_Experiment start date_Country. “F” stands for Fieldbook in this case.

item.title: Send KDSmart file to mobile device
item.description: Once you have downloaded a .kdx file, you have to send it to the device where KDSmart is installed. For this you have three options: Via email: send an email to yourself or the data collector, with the .kdx file attached. Open this email on the mobile device where KDSmart is installed and download the .kdx file in the folder ‘’Download’’ of the mobile device. Via a cloud: On your laptop save the .

item.title: Adding a Funding agency – Project management entity – Experiment lead
item.description: Click on the + button to add a new line.

item.title: AgroFIMS workflow
item.description: AgroFIMS works in collaboration with the Android applications like KDSmart, ODK Collect and Field Book apps to provide a complete workflow to manage data for the creation of a fieldbook to the data analysis. Below are the different steps to follow to create, collect, analyze and save data using AgroFIMS:

item.title: Deleting a fieldbook
item.description: Click on the red bin icon at the right of the fielbook line to remove it.

item.title: May I import a list of varieties or genotypes?
item.description: It is not currently possible to import a list of varieties or genotypes. You have to manually enter your list in the text box: Variety name(s)

item.title: Removing personnel
item.description: Click on the red cross at the top right of the personnel box to remove it.

item.title: Save the files in your mobile memory
item.description: Save the .csv file in the folder field_import of the main folder fieldBook created by the app on the mobile device. Save the .trt file in the trait folder of the folder fieldBook created by the app on the mobile device

item.title: Updating a site
item.description: A site cannot be updated. You must create a new site.

item.title: Updating your password
item.description: Log in. Click on at the top right corner of the Home page. Select Autentication Enter your current password and a new password. Click ‘’Update password’’. Your password has been updated and you can now log in with your new password.

item.title: Modifying your profile
item.description: You can view your profile information by selecting Account > Profile in the Menu. If you wish to update your profile information, please send an email to agrofims@cgiar.org.

item.title: Open fieldbook in KDSmart
item.description: Once the .kdx file in stored in your mobile device, you can open it in KDsmart following this tutorial (cf. tutorial )

item.title: Open the files in Field Book
item.description: Open Field Book. Go Fields. Click on the + at the top right and select Local storage. Select the .csv field exported from AgroFIMS, and then validate the radio button next to it. Go back to the main menu and select Traits. Click on the three dots at the top right and select ‘’Import/Export’’. Select ‘’Import’’ and then ‘’Local storage’’.

item.title: Removing a Funding agency – Project management entity – Experiment lead
item.description: Click on the red cross at the upper right side of the box to remove it.

item.title: Requesting a new password
item.description: At the upper right corner of the Home page, click on Select Forgot your password? Enter your email and click on Reset my password A new password will be sent to your email address. Don’t forget to check your spam folder

item.title: Site
item.description: In this section you can describe the experimental site and its surroundings.

item.title: What is a site ID?
item.description: The site ID is a unique identifier automatically generated by AgroFIMS to distinguish the sites in your sites list.

item.title: Deleting a Site
item.description: Go to Sites in the Menu. Click on bin icon next to the site you want to delete.

item.title: Identify the plots
item.description: In KDSmart the plots can be named either by their number or by the number of their column, row and block. Download a trial (cf. KDSmart tutorial ) Click on the three dots at the top left (1) Select “Trials” (2) Select your trial in the list to open “Trial Details” Click on the edit icon next to “Plot identification” Select “Plot” if you want to identify the plots by their number, select “Block/Field Column/Field Row” if you prefer to identify the plots with their Block/Column and Row numbers.

item.title: May I leave a case blank?
item.description: The mandatory fields are marked with a red asterisk. All other fields may be left blank. However, we recommend that you provide as much information about your experiment as possible. Robust metadata will allow better understanding and interpretation of your data set, and greatly augment its discovery and re-use in the immediate and distant future, assuring that your data continues to provide value well after collection.

item.title: Design
item.description: Find below the steps to create a fieldbook in AgroFIMS.

item.title: old page
item.description: Signing Up Go to AgroFIMS. Enter your email, password, name, last name, organization and country. Click Create. Your account has been created. You can Log in and start using AgroFIMS. An email will be sent to your mailbox to confirm your account. Don’t forget to check your spam folder if you don’t see the email in your inbox! Logging in At the upper right corner of the Home page, click on and select Log In Enter your email and your password.

item.title: Where to find the information filled in AgroFIMS
item.description: In Trial Details Click on the three dots at the top left of KDSmart screen. Select “Trials”. Select your trial in the list to open the Trial Details page of your experiment. Experiment objective is noted as Note (3) Measurements (Crop, Phenology, Soil, Management practices to be collected in the field) are listed as “Traits”. (4) Experiment, personnel, site, crop and design information are listed under “Trial attributes”.

item.title: Fertilizer
item.description: Find below the steps to add fertilizer applications in your protocol.

item.title: Management practices
item.description: Find below the steps to add management practices in your protocol.

item.title: Crop measurements
item.description: In this section you can select and describe the measurements to be made on the crops.

item.title: Phenology measurements
item.description: Find below the steps to create a fieldbook in AgroFIMS. Phenology measurements 1.

item.title: Soil measurements
item.description: This section is dedicated to the selection of soil measurements to make during the experiment.

item.title: Weather measurements
item.description: This section is dedicated to the selection of weather measurements to make during the experiment. Selecting a weather measurement Select a measurement in the drop-down list. You can either scroll through the list or delete the default and type the name of your measurement – the auto-complete feature will select the term if the measurement is in the list. Once you have found your measurement, select it and click on .
